main: ^The crowds are nice here, aren’t they? Doesn’t it feel freeing to be with people like you?
^I don’t think I can stay for a drink, actually. I forgot I have to head home to help my mom out with some chores.
^Really? I thought you wanted to get away from her for a bit?
^Yeah, I think it’s been long enough.
^Ugh, Reyes. You know you don't have to listen to her. You’re an adult, you don’t need to do everything she says.
^I mean, it’s not like she appreciates you anyways. The way she talks about you proves that.
^I wouldn’t say that… she’s just complicated.
^No, I get it. She makes you feel guilty and that’s why you’re defending her.
^I am defending her because she’s my MOM. She can be complicated, but I love her.
^Really? What about everything she’s done up until now? You really don’t think she should be held accountable for that?
^Yes, of course! But I’m not going to hate her when I just want her to grow…
arg1: ^You don’t need to teach her to accept you, Reyes. The people who will understand you are HERE.
^No, the people who understand YOU are here.
^that not everyone can spend $10 on a coffee.
^how mean that barista was to me.
arg1wrong: ^What are you even talking about, Reyes? That doesn't have anything to do with this.
^Maybe that wasn't the best way to word that. Let me think about that one again...
arg2: ^Okay, but like, not every coffee costs that much! I just got what I wanted. You didn't need to get one if you didn't want one.
^Harper, that's not what the problem is. I'm saying that everything here costs that much. You just don't see it.
^It's not even that bad, Reyes. We could have gone to a cheaper cafe. We'll go to a cheaper one next time, or we'll just go somewhere else.
^Somewhere else isn't cheaper, either! For example...
^There aren't even any other cafes around here!
^Every store at the mall is a designer brand!
^I'd have to go back home to buy food!
arg2wrong: ^What are you even talking about, Reyes? That doesn't have anything to do with this.
^Maybe that wasn't the best way to word that. Let me think about that one again...
arg3: ^That "thrift store" you were talking about isn't even a thrift store, it's a secondhand boutique.
^That's like the same thing, Reyes. "Thrift" is secondhand.
^No, Harper, it's not. There's questions about financial accessibility, like ...
^You don't pay $40 at a thrift store.
^Thrift stores carry different kinds of clothes.
^There just aren't real thrift stores here.
arg3wrong: ^What are you even talking about, Reyes? That doesn't have anything to do with this.
^Maybe that wasn't the best way to word that. Let me think about that one again...
endchunk: ^Reyes, I don't understand what you mean. Can you just calm down a bit and we can talk this over? Maybe over that drink.
^Y’know, we can just get that drink another time. I’ll see you around Harper.
